p: The observed free radicals scavenging potential of essential oil sample of E. umbellata estimated through DPPH and ABTS assays, was significant and comparable with that of the positive control ascorbic acid. The highest percent scavenging potential observed were; 85.24 ± 0.63, 88.30 ± 0.81 respectively against DPPH (Fig. 3a) and ABTS (Fig. 3b) at the highest concentration of 1000 μg/mL with IC 50 values of 70 and 105 μg/mL respectively. The standard ascorbic acid caused an inhibition of 91.56 ± 0.35 and 92.63 ± 0.99% against DPPH and ABTS at the highest concentration 1000 μg/mL with IC 50 values of 32 and 29 μg/mL respectively.
